Posts.Content: DX2008 wrote: I am 37 years old, diagnosed with DIC on July 1st this year.  I am waiting for my bilateral mastectomy done in September.  My tumor is in the right breast and I have lymph node enlargement. 3 enlarged nodes accordig to MRI and 2 according to PET. I can definately feel one (about 2 cm) myself. A few days ago, I felt something like a thin cord running across in my right axilla area.  I have occasional pain in my outer upper chest (my tumor is in right inner upper quadrant) and tingling sensation running down my right arm, which was more noticeable fefore I notice the cord. Needless to say, I don't have any cords in my left axilla. Is cording (AKA axillary web syndrome) even possible before mastectomy?  Has anyone experienced something similar before? Thanks Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cording before mastectomy? DX2008 DX2008

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2008 05:33PM DX2008 wrote: Annie and Tender,  Thanks for your quick replies.  I only noticed the cording a few days ago, and I got core biopsy done about 2 months ago.  I started to wonder if the cording and lymph node swelling have anything to do with the core biopsy. I don't know if lymph nodes stay swollen 2 months after biopsy though... I will be very happy if they indeed find out the enlarged lymph nodes are just reactive and not cancerous.  I guess there is no way of telling now and I just have to wait until mastectomy and final biopsy report comes out. Yours, DX
Posts.Title: Cording before mastectomy? DX2008 DX2008
